details.journalTitle: The Research and Innovation Symposium for European SECURITY and Defense
details.publisher: Satways Ltd. Information Technologies Institute - Centre for Research and Technology Hellas Bulgarian Defence Institute

project.title: Deployment and Assessment of Predictive modelling, environmentally sustainable and emerging digital technologies and tools for improving the resilience of IWW against Climate change and other extremes

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europes financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as Digital transition).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europes financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europes financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europes financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europes financial contribution to Europes biodiversitys path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

article.title: Bringing smart mobility into the sharing economy
article.teaser: The EU-funded SMASH project has developed an integrated mobility service where everyone can easily share their cars, bikes, parking spots, trucks and charging stations with others.

section.sectionBody:
When we talk about vehicle sharing, we typically think ride sharing programmes or urban bike renting initiatives. These systems have traditionally been independent and centralised. As a result, city centres across Europe have been invaded by free floating bikes and electric scooters offering little to no benefit in terms of open and sustainable urban mobility.
What if there was a system that smashed everything together from motorcycles to bicycles, cars to buses into an integrated, managed and open source smart mobility system? This is exactly what the EU-funded SMASH project set out to do.
SMASH is an integrated mobility service, a platform where everyone can share their own vehicles with others. Whether you have a bike or a car that youre not using, you can use SMASH to rent it out to other users, says project coordinator Alessandro Cantore. However, unlike these other programmes, SMASH is all encompassing, meaning a user can rent a bike to get to a car that they can then use to drive to the nearest train station they can even use the SMASH app to find a parking spot or a recharging station!
Supply and demand
As SMASH aims to meet both the supply and the demand side of the shared mobility equation, the system is comprised of several innovative technologies.
On the supply side, there is the https://www.smartsharing.biz/ (SMASH device). Developed by lead partner Greenspider, the device integrates a https://www.gsa.europa.eu/european-gnss/what-gnss (GNSS) receiver, Near Field Communication (NFC), Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) and GPRS module for connecting to the cloud all into a single, ultra-low-power electronic circuit. Once the device is installed, the owner can then share their component via the SMASH app.
With just a few clicks, anyone, including fleet operators and private individuals, can register and become a service provider, sharing their own mobility services on our open source smartphone app, explains Cantore. Along with listing the components exact location, you can also include pictures, relevant data and the terms and conditions for accessing and using the shared object.
By accessing the SMASH app via a unique social login, users can immediately see all the available mobility options on a user-generated map. One can also narrow a search by vehicle type, location and availability. Users book using the virtual SMASH wallet, which can be recharged via the SMASH Token mobile payment system. The wallet can also be used to pay any deposits or down payments required by the owner. Rates are typically defined by time of use but can fluctuate depending on demand. To ensure that all transactions are safe and secure, the SMASH system utilises blockchain technology.
Sustainable, smart mobility
SMASH is currently in its pilot phase, with thousands of vehicles and other mobility related components being shared in cities across Europe. Fleet operators and vehicle manufacturers are also adopting SMASH as a native technology in the production phase of their smart vehicles.
Although SMASH supports all the features of traditional vehicle sharing, it does so as an open, peer-to-peer model where everyone can be both a user and a provider of shared mobility solutions, adds Cantore. By joining the SMASH sharable universe, we can all play a role in building the sustainable, smart and convenient urban mobility systems of tomorrow.

article.keywords: SMASH, ride sharing, smart mobility, Greenspider, GNSS

article.title: Des solutions innovantes et durables pour lexploration minire
article.teaser: Les technologies dexploration innovantes dveloppes par les projets financs dans le cadre dHorizon2020 dans le but de trouver des minerais mtalliques et des minraux aident lEurope passer une conomie durable, comptitive et conome en ressources, tout en rpondant aux dfis environnementaux et climatiques. Ce Results Packs met lhonneur huitprojets europens de pointe qui contribuent mettre en uvre cette transition.

section.sectionBody:
Laccs aux ressources est lune des questions de scurit les plus stratgiques entourant la mise en uvre du https://ec.europa.eu/info/publications/communication-european-green-deal_fr (pacte vert pour lEurope). Le pacte vert vise faire de lEurope le premier continent neutre en carbone dici 2050. Conformment cet engagement, la Commission europenne a adopt en juillet2021 une srie de https://ec.europa.eu/clima/eu-action/european-green-deal/2030-climate-target-plan_fr (propositions lgislatives), y compris lobjectif intermdiaire dune rduction nette dau moins 55% des missions de gaz effet de serre dici 2030.
Lutilisation durable des matires premires, notamment des mtaux et des minraux, et en particulier des matires premires critiques comme les terres rares, constitue lune des principales conditions pralables ce changement. Cela sexplique par leur rle vital dans les chanes de valeur industrielles, tout particulirement dans les secteurs de lnergie, de la mobilit, des TIC et de la dfense, ainsi que dans le dveloppement de technologies dnergie renouvelable, de vhicules lectriques et de tlphones portables, entre autres.

Alors que la demande de matires premires augmente, la recherche et linnovation finances par lUE dans le cadre dHorizon2020 contribuent amliorer laccs aux mtaux et aux minraux, tout en optimisant leur consommation et en amliorant leurs conditions dextraction en Europe.
Lexploration minire a pour but de rechercher des concentrations commercialement viables de minerais et de minraux des fins dexploitation. Une estimation trs prcise du volume des gisements savre cruciale en raison du caractre capitalistique de lexploitation minire.
Parmi les approches innovantes et durables visant dcouvrir des mtaux et des minraux figurent lexploration et la cartographie autonomes des mines inondes et des fonds marins afin dobtenir les informations haute rsolution ncessaires pour une identification fiable des gisements. Une autre mthode consiste amliorer la prcision des gomodles et lvaluation conomique des rserves minires.
Par ailleurs, rduire le cot lev de lexploration et stimuler la participation de la socit civile ds les premires phases de lexploration permettra de sensibiliser les communauts locales et les autres parties prenantes et damliorer leur comprhension. Faire passer les technologies les plus prometteuses lchelle suprieure puis les lancer sur le march renforcera la comptitivit des industries europennes dans ce secteur.

section.sectionTitle: Un regard plus approfondi sur la recherche europenne
section.sectionBody:
Dans ce Results Pack CORDIS, nous nous concentrons sur les rsultats innovants obtenus par les projets financs par Horizon2020 qui travaillent sur des technologies dexploration visant assurer un approvisionnement durable en matires premires.
Le projet https://cordis.europa.eu/article/id/413474/fr (HiTech AlkCarb) rassemble des partenaires dEurope et dAfrique afin damliorer de manire significative les modles gologiques dexploration des matires premires hi-tech (utiles aux hautes technologies) comme les terres rares associes aux roches alcalines et aux carbonatites.
Le projet https://cordis.europa.eu/article/id/413476-a-high-tech-robotic-diver-analyses-the-earth-s-mineral-riches-on-the-ocean-floor/fr (ROBUST) dveloppe un systme robotis autonome de prospection pour identifier et analyser des nodules polymtalliques situs dans les profondeurs des ocans. https://cordis.europa.eu/article/id/413479-a-look-back-in-time-could-reveal-a-way-forward-for-europe-s-uncharted-treasures/fr (UNEXMIN) cre un robot hautement sophistiqu pour explorer et cartographier les mines inondes, rcuprer des donnes gologiques et effectuer des analyses de la chimie de leau et des proprits des parois minires, tandis que le projet https://cordis.europa.eu/article/id/413478-bit-by-bit-to-a-more-sustainable-metal-and-mining-sector/fr (SOLSA) combine forage sonique, matriel danalyse et informatique afin doptimiser les performances des activits minires.
Le projet https://cordis.europa.eu/article/id/413475/fr (INFACT) conoit des technologies dexploration minire innovantes, non invasives et socialement acceptables pour aider tirer profit du potentiel inexploit des mines, quil sagisse de sites nouveaux ou existants. Enfin, les projets https://cordis.europa.eu/article/id/413477-high-tech-and-legacy-data-open-new-avenues-to-deep-mineral-exploration/fr (Smart Exploration), https://cordis.europa.eu/article/id/436268-finding-new-minerals-in-europe-using-environment-friendly-low-cost-technologies/fr (PACIFIC) et https://cordis.europa.eu/article/id/436267-efficient-mineral-exploration-with-reduced-environmental-impact/fr (NEXT) dveloppent des solutions rentables et respectueuses de lenvironnement pour lexploration minire et ralisent des tudes pour mieux comprendre les facteurs qui influencent lacceptation de lexploration minire par le grand public.

result.title: "Report on microbiome dynamics and circulations across aquaculture actors ""farm-to-fork"""
result.description: The report will include data regarding identification and setup of lab-in-the-field sites (Task 5.1) and results of the longitudinal monitoring of microbiome dynamics and circulations across the Atlantic salmon and seabream aquaculture actors, from farm to fork (fish from egg to slaughter, feeds/supplements, processing and production system/environment, workers, food), as well as identification of correlations between food chain microbiomes and performance parameters (Task 5.2).
